events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection, requesting immediate assistance.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords related to vehicle collision and damage.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and coordinate next steps.
The customer received acknowledgment that their claim related to the vehicle accident had been registered successfully.
The claims agent requested photos of the damaged car, police report, and witness statements to proceed with investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including repair estimates, collision photos, and the police accident report.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence to verify the facts and assess liability for the auto collision.
The investigation was concluded, confirming the insured partyâ€™s vehicle was damaged in a covered car accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs and medical expenses related to the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and the fairness of the proposed settlement.
The claim was approved after final confirmation, authorizing the release of funds to repair the insured vehicle.
Payment was issued promptly to the customer's designated repair shop to cover the automobile damages incurred.
The claim was officially closed following the successful payment and confirmation of repair completion on the vehicle.
